Articles.Content:
<p><img src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/787946ff9dfb8c524eafc78201ffb1df/tumblr_inline_mzte5gL1nE1rr2wit.jpg"/></p>

<p><span class="userContent">Many thanks to our friends at <a href="http://gaming.logitech.com/"><strong>Logitech Gaming</strong></a>. We were overwhelmed by amount of cool gear they sent us. We got sent so much, in fact, that we didn’t know what to do with some of it at first. In the end, we decided to do what we do best - build a rocket.</span></p>
awesome. I use the G700s myself. really nice mouse, never have to clean it, and has plenty of buttons...

We got sent so much, in fact, that we didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t know what to do with some of it at first

I'll PM you my address

The DFGTs!

I have an old Driving Force for PS2 (the original one), not sure if I can get it working on PC.
Am I the only one who's now considering how to steer a rocket with a wheel?
I love Logitech. I have a G400s mouse, G710+ keyboard, and a G430 headset from Christmas. Seeing that they know Squad is even more awesome.
...I'll take one off you.
i wonder how much ÃŽâ€V those logitech boxes have?
What's the isp of a logitech steering wheel?
Logitech is my favorite. I've got a g510 keyboard and g700 mouse.

Yea, only use logitech as well. Was a little angry when i couldn't get one of the Logitech U96's i was so used to anymore last year, when the last of the ones i had in sock died. Had to switch to Logitech B110 and it took quite some time till my accuracy was back to my earlier average.

Anyway, nice rocket. What is its twr & delta-V?

I have a g500, and it has never failed me. I'm thinking about getting a keyboard too.

Any chance you guys could send me a spare?

While I'm not a fan of logitech myself, I wonder if this will make the dev team put a little more effort into supporting us analog players. KSP currently has a fit whenever I try to fly it on my stick (Saitek X52 Pro).

Well, Logitech makes some good peripherals For example: i have a Logitech MOMO (black) wheel, a Driving force GT, the G27 and a G13 gameboard.

So, you could say i'm pretty pleased with the quality.

Am I the only one who is immediately interested in why they sent all this stuff? Did Squad win a contest? I hope it means we'll get better key bind support and useful joystick implementation now though.
I don't see ANY struts!

While I'm not a fan of logitech myself, I wonder if this will make the dev team put a little more effort into supporting us analog players. KSP currently has a fit whenever I try to fly it on my stick (Saitek X52 Pro).

Good, then I'm not the only one having issues with the X52P

Good, then I'm not the only one having issues with the X52P

Let me guess, you push the stick to about 20% it's total possible deflection, and KSP registers it to be floored. Right?

Many thanks to our friends at Logitech Gaming. We were overwhelmed by amount of cool gear they sent us. We got sent so much, in fact, that we didnÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t know what to do with some of it at first. In the end, we decided to do what we do best - build a rocket.

interesting, although it does not seem to be of fire... or exploding.

I love Logitechs wireless trackball, but for KB, I prefer Microsofts. Always had good results with their wireless KB, my old logitech KB had to have a clear line of site to work, not so with the Microsoft one. (Oddly, not so with the wireless Logitech trackball either...) I have a Thrustmaster wireless Skuderia 430 cockpit wheel (GRID, Driver SF, F1) and a Thrustmaster flightstick ( Warbirds, Combat Flight Simulator, KSP (if it would work correctly)), (don't remember the model and don't want to get up and check). Soon I will replace my headphones and Xbox controller to wireless as well, then ALL of my HIDs will be wireless.

Jeb wishes I had a better computer....he has plans I tell you.

My computer is my best friend, and KSP my mistress.......(wife grumbles in background...)

Tip of the day: When life gives you lemons, make a nice furniture polish and sell it on late night tv!

interesting, although it does not seem to be of fire... or exploding.
Also, it seems more stable than my usual thing.

that's a very nice rocket. I had a little laugh when I saw it, I thought it funny how many different Logitech devices you have there.

I have their speakers, mouse, keyboard, joystick and headphones. I didn't deliberately get all their devices it just that when I wanted something new I looked at what was around and chose their device. They make some nice stuff.

Which leads me to a question or more a hope. I have a G15 keyboard with a LCD display. I don't know if it's a no-no to ask for KSP to use the LCD in some capacity but I can only hope that squad might use the keyboard displays for something in-game.

Anyways that looks great and keep up the good work people.

@Mick2> Check around, there is a mod for the G15 series keyboards. I have two G510s (One for work, and one for home) and I also had two ORIGINAL G15 keyboards before something went wrong with them. I've been pondering the mod, but, really, I'm paying more attention to the screen than the LCD.
So good, i use a Logitech Extreme 3d Pro myself for flying, but the rest of that gear is amazing as well

You guys, Logitech hooked us up so freakin' good. Not only did HQ get stuff, but I, as well as the other North American team members got stuff, too. We're rationing up stuff to keep for ourselves, send to the European team members and save for *ahem* other occasions down the road Still, though, big, big ups to the folks at Logitech and I'm glad that you enjoyed HQ's goofy rocket. They had fun with it for sure.
